artist: Artist: Itō Shinsui; Publisher: Watanabe Shōzaburō
creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
description: portrait; head and torso of a woman with her hands against her PL cheek, wearing a dark blue garment with light blue x's and a dark blue hat; dark sky with stars; wooden bucket LLC
inscription: 大正十一年十月十二日 {Taishō jūichinen jūgatsu jūninichi} (October 12th, 1922)
markings: red artist\'s seal: 伊東 {Itō}; LBC, publisher seal: ワタナベ {Watanabe}; on back, red seal: 貮百枚限り絶版　第一九一番 {nihyaku mai kagiri zeppan, dai hyakukyūjūichi ban} (limited edition of 200, number 191)
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Twelve Forms of New Beauties (Shin bijin jūni sugata 新美人十二姿)
text: This beauty wears the indigo-dyed attire traditional on O_shima Island, including a cotton towel (tenugui) on the head to ease carrying water buckets.
title: Woman from Ōshima Island
